entry.title: An overview of the Kepler conjecture
entry.summary: This is the first in a series of papers giving a proof of the Kepler conjecture, which asserts that the density of a packing of congruent spheres in three dimensions is never greater than $\pi/\sqrt{18}\approx 0.74048...$. This is the oldest problem in discrete geometry and is an important part of Hilbert's 18th problem. An example of a packing achieving this density is the face-centered cubic packing. This paper has a historical overview and a synopsis of the rest of the series. The other papers in the series are math.MG/9811072, math.MG/9811073, math.MG/9811074, math.MG/9811075, math.MG/9811076, math.MG/9811077, and math.MG/9811078.

entry.title: Sub-Riemannian geometry and Lie groups. Part II. Curvature of metric spaces, coadjoint orbits and associated representations
entry.summary: This paper is the third in a series dedicated to the fundamentals of sub-Riemannian geometry and its implications in Lie groups theory: "Sub-Riemannian geometry and Lie groups. Part I", math.MG/0210189, available at http://arxiv.org/abs/math.MG/0210189, and "Tangent bundles to sub-Riemannian groups", math.MG/0307342, available at http://arxiv.org/abs/math.MG/0307342 .

entry.title: Theory of valuations on manifolds: a survey
entry.summary: This is a non-technical survey of a recent theory of valuations on manifolds constructed in math.MG/0503397, math.MG/0503399, math.MG/0509512, math.MG/0511171 and actually a guide to this series of articles. We review also some recent related results obtained by a number of people. We formulate some open questions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages; revised version: order of sections has been changed; typos

entry.title: Coxeter Decompositions of Bounded Hyperbolic Pyramids and Triangular Prisms
entry.summary: Coxeter decompositions of hyperbolic simplices where studied in math.MG/0212010 and math.MG/0210067. In this paper we use the methods of these works to classify Coxeter decompositions of bounded convex pyramids and triangular prisms in the hyperbolic space H^3.

entry.title: Aperiodic linearly repetitive Delone sets are densely repetitive
entry.summary: We show that aperiodic linearly repetitive Delone sets are densely repetitive. This confirms a conjecture of Lagarias and Pleasants.

entry.title: Coxeter Decompositions of Hyperbolic Tetrahedra
entry.summary: We classify Coxeter decompositions of hyperbolic tetrahedra, i.e. simplices in the hyperbolic space H^3. The paper completes the classification of Coxeter decompositions of hyperbolic simplices.

entry.title: Intrinsic L_p metrics for convex bodies
entry.summary: Intrinsic $L_p$ metrics are defined and shown to satisfy a dimension--free bound with respect to the Hausdorff metric.

entry.title: Some observations on the simplex
entry.summary: We investigate the space of simplices in Euclidean Space
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Bolyai Conference proceedings

entry.title: Some Remarks on the Geodesic Completeness of Compact Nonpositively Curved Spaces
entry.summary: We make some remarks on the existence of a geodesically complete core for any compact non-positively curved space.

entry.title: Cocompact CAT(0) spaces are almost geodesically complete
entry.summary: We prove that, under certain mild conditions, every cocompact CAT(0) space is almost geodesically complete.

entry.title: Hexagonal surfaces of Kapouleas
entry.summary: For the "hexagonal" norm on R^3, for which the isoperimetric shape is a hexagonal prism rather than a round ball, we give analogs of the compact immersed constant-mean-curvature surfaces of Kapouleas.

entry.title: Groups with a polynomial dimension growth
entry.summary: We show that finitely generated groups with a polynomial dimension growth have Yu's property A and give an example of such groups.

entry.title: Building-like spaces
entry.summary: We study convex subsets of buildings, discuss some structural features and derive several characterizations of buildings.

entry.title: Centers of convex subsets of buildings
entry.summary: We prove that two dimensional convex subsets of spherical buildings are either buildings or have a center.

entry.title: A Note on Self-extremal Sets in $L_p(\Om)$ Spaces
entry.summary: We give a geometric characterization of self-extremal sets in $L_p(\Om)$ spaces that partially extends our previous results to the case of $L_p$\ spaces.

entry.title: Free construction of CAT(1) spaces
entry.summary: We construct several non-trivial examples of CAT(1) spaces by using the idea of free construction.

entry.title: Spaces with many affine functions
entry.summary: We describe all metric spaces that have sufficently many affine functions. As an application we obtain a metric characterization of linear-convex subsets of Banach spaces.

entry.title: The de Rham decomposition theorem for metric spaces
entry.summary: We generalize the classical de Rham decomposition theorem for Riemannian manifolds to the setting of geodesic metric spaces of finite dimension.

entry.title: Quasi-metric and metric spaces
entry.summary: We give a short review of a construction of Frink to obtain a metric space from a quasi-metric space. By an example we illustrate the limits of the construction.

entry.title: An application of metric cotype to quasisymmetric embeddings
entry.summary: We apply the notion of metric cotype to show that $L_p$ admits a quasisymmetric embedding into $L_q$ if and only if $p\le q$ or $q\le p\le 2$.

entry.title: Higher dimensional conundra
entry.summary: We study asymptotics of various Euclidean geometric phenomena as the dimension tend to infinity.

entry.title: Mass in the Hyperbolic Plane
entry.summary: The notions of mass and center of mass are extended to laminae of the hyperbolic plane. The resulting formulae contain many surprises.

entry.title: What is a metric space?
entry.summary: The question in the title is discussed briefly, with emphasis on a few basic examples and their properties.

entry.title: Equivariant embeddings of Hermitian symmetric spaces
entry.summary: We prove that equivariant, holomorphic embeddings of Hermitian symmetric spaces are totally geodesic (when the image is not of exceptional type).

entry.title: An introduction to the geometry of metric spaces
entry.summary: These informal notes deal with some basic properties of metric spaces, especially concerning lengths of curves.

entry.title: Dimension Reduction for the Hyperbolic Space
entry.summary: A dimension reduction for the hyperbolic space is established. When points are far apart an embedding with bounded distortion into the hyperbolic plane is achieved.

entry.title: On the Kirchheim-Magnani counterexample to metric differentiability
entry.summary: In this short note we give an interpretation of the Kirchheim-Magnani counterexample to metric differentiability in terms of dilatation structures.

entry.title: Another introduction to the geometry of metric spaces
entry.summary: Here Lipschitz conditions are used as a primary tool, for studying curves in metric spaces in particular.

entry.title: Elementary aspects of the geometry of metric spaces
entry.summary: The setting of metric spaces is very natural for numerous questions concerning manifolds, norms, and fractal sets, and a few of the main ingredients are surveyed here.

entry.title: An introduction to the geometry of ultrametric spaces
entry.summary: Some examples and basic properties of ultrametric spaces are briefly discussed.

entry.title: Affine buildings for dihedral groups
entry.summary: We construct rank 2 thick nondiscrete affine buildings associated with an arbitrary finite dihedral group.

entry.title: Ahlfors-David regular sets and bilipschitz maps
entry.summary: Given two Ahlfors-David regular sets in metric spaces, we study the question whether one of them has a subset bilipschitz equivalent with the other.

entry.title: On a spherical code in the space of spherical harmonics
entry.summary: In this short note we propose a new method for construction new nice arrangement on the sphere $S^d$ using the spaces of spherical harmonic.

entry.title: Sur le spectre des longueurs des groupes de triangles
entry.summary: We describe in this report the beginning of the length spectra of fuchsian triangular groups

entry.title: On Gromov's Waist of the Sphere Theorem
entry.summary: The goal of this paper is to give a detailed and complete proof of M. Gromov's waist of the sphere theorem.

entry.title: Infinitesimal Bishop-Gromov condition for Alexandrov spaces
entry.summary: We prove the infinitesimal version of Bishop-Gromov volume comparison condition for Alexandrov spaces.

entry.title: On cake dividing
entry.summary: We consider Steinhaus cake dividing game.

entry.title: On the equality conditions of the Brunn-Minkowski theorem
entry.summary: This article describes a new proof of the equality condition for the Brunn-Minkowski inequality.

entry.title: Convex quadric surfaces
entry.summary: We describe convex quadric surfaces in n dimensions and characterize them as convex surfaces with quadric sections by a continuous family of hyperplanes.

entry.title: Hausdorff dimension and capacities of compact sets
entry.summary: We give a complete proof of the expression of capacities of a measure in terms of its Fourier transform.

entry.title: Introduction to metric spaces with dilations
entry.summary: This paper gives a short introduction into the metric theory of spaces with dilations.

entry.title: Continuality of set of biLipschitz classes in Euclidean space
entry.summary: The main result of this paper is Theorem. For every integer $d\geqslant 2$ the set of biLipschitz classes in $\mathbb{E}^d$ has cardinality continuum.

entry.title: Miquel circles and Cevian lines
entry.summary: Two theorems are presented concerning the Miquel point configuration, when the operative points on the sides of the triangle are the feet of Cevians,

entry.title: A Construction to find any Circle through a Given Point
entry.summary: A construction similar to Hagge's construction for circles through the orthocentre is shown to apply for any point.

entry.title: Eight circles through the Orthocentre
entry.summary: A construction is given of five Hagge circles complete with supporting calculations.

entry.title: On two-dimensional shape-preserving approximation
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate a problem of approximation of continuous mappings by smooth mappings with nonnegative Jacobian.

entry.title: Geometries of convex and finite sets of geodesic spaces
entry.summary: The work consists of solutions of metric problems for convex and finite subsets of geodesic spaces.

entry.title: Arbitrary Sectioning of Angles in Taxicab Geometry
entry.summary: A construction to arbitrarily section a taxicab angle into an equal number of angles in (pure) taxicab geometry is presented.

entry.title: On lines in a triangle tangent to a conic
entry.summary: We present generalizations of theorems on Kypert's construction and on 2nd Morley's Centre. Most of our proofs are synthetic.

entry.title: Stability of volume comparison for complex convex bodies
entry.summary: We prove stability in the affirmative part of the Busemann-Petty problem on sections of complex convex bodies.

entry.title: Local maxima of energy of point configurations on sphere
entry.summary: We prove that certain energy functionals of point configurations on sphere have no local maxima.

entry.title: On two recent conjectures in convex geometry
entry.summary: Two conjectures recently proposed by one of the authors are disproved

entry.title: Normed groupoids with dilations
entry.summary: We study normed groupoids with dilations and their induced deformations.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: this contains the content of arXiv:0911.1300

entry.title: Differentiable structures on metric measure spaces: A Primer
entry.summary: This is an exposition of the theory of differentiable structures on metric measures spaces, in the sense of Cheeger and Keith.

entry.title: Metric spaces with subexponential asymptotic dimension growth
entry.summary: We prove that a metric space with subexponential asymptotic dimension growth has Yu's property A.

entry.title: The Area Formula for Lipschitz Mappings of Carnot--Carathéodory Spaces
entry.summary: We prove the sub-Riemannian analog of the area formula for Lipschitz (in sub-Riemannian sense) mappings of equiregular Carnot--Carath\'{e}odory spaces.

entry.title: Two infinite versions of nonlinear Dvoretzky's theorem
entry.summary: We investigate nonlinear Dvoretzky's theorem for countably infinite metric spaces and analytic sets whose Hausdorff dimension are infinite.

entry.title: A coarse invariant
entry.summary: This note extends the invariant defined in "An invariant of metric spaces under bornologous equivalences" to the coarse category.

entry.title: On counterexamples in questions of unique determination of convex bodies
entry.summary: We discuss a construction that gives counterexamples to various questions of unique determination of convex bodies.

entry.title: A hyperplane inequality for the surface area of projection bodies
entry.summary: We prove a hyperplane inequality for the surface area of projection bodies.

entry.title: A Flat Strip Theorem for Ptolemaic Spaces
entry.summary: We prove a flat strip theorem for 2-dimensional ptolemaic spaces.

entry.title: Solid Angle of Conical Surfaces, Polyhedral Cones, and Intersecting Spherical Caps
entry.summary: This paper presents formulae for calculation the solid angle of intersecting spherical caps, conical surfaces and polyhedral cones.

entry.title: Taxicab Calculus: Trig Derivatives
entry.summary: The set of trigonometric functions in taxicab geometry is completed and derivatives of all of the taxicab trigonometric functions are explored.

entry.title: Hyperbolic Spaces and Ptolemy Moebius Structures
entry.summary: We characterize the class of Gromov hyperbolic spaces, whose boundary at infinity allow canonical M\"obius structures.

entry.title: The n-point Condition and Rough CAT(0)
entry.summary: We show that for n > 4 a length space (X,d) satisfies a rough n-point condition if and only it it is rough CAT(0).

entry.title: A note on extensions of approximate ultrametrics
entry.summary: An ultrametric defined on a subset S of a metric space X can be extended to X while roughly preserving distances between pairs in S x X.

entry.title: Dyadic cubes in spaces of homogeneous type
entry.summary: We give a comprehensive representation of the construction of dyadic cubes in spaces of homogeneous type.

entry.title: Injective hulls of odd cycles
entry.summary: The injective hulls of odd cycles are described explicitly.

entry.title: Ishikawa iteration process on CAT(K) spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we establish $\Delta$-convergence results for Ishikawa iterations in complete CAT(K) spaces.

entry.title: Jung's Theorem and fixed points for $p$-uniformly convex spaces
entry.summary: We introduce the classical Jung theorem and fixed point theorems and prove similar ones for $p$-uniformly convex spaces.

entry.title: The Ptolemaean Inequality in H--type groups
entry.summary: We prove the Ptolemaean Inequality and the Theorem of Ptolemaeus in the setting of $H$--type groups of Iwasawa--type.

entry.title: The Mazur-Ulam theorem
entry.summary: A short proof of the Mazur-Ulam theorem concerning isometries of real normed spaces.

entry.title: On the Theorem of the Three Perpendiculars
entry.summary: We show that the theorem of the three perpendiculars holds in any n-dimensional space form.

entry.title: New examples of hexagonal webs of circles
entry.summary: We give several new examples of hexagonal 3-webs of circles in the plane and give a survey on such webs.

entry.title: A $sqrt{n}$ estimate for measures of hyperplane sections of convex bodies
entry.summary: We prove an estimate for arbitrary measure of sections of convex bodies. The proof is based on a stability result for intersection bodies.

entry.title: Slicing inequalities for subspaces of $L_p.$
entry.summary: We show that the hyperplane conjecture holds for the classes of $k$-intersection bodies with arbitrary measures in place of volume.

entry.title: A hyperplane inequality for measures of unconditional convex bodies
entry.summary: We prove an inequality that extends to arbitrary measures the hyperplane inequality for volume of unconditional convex bodies originally observed by Bourgain.

entry.title: Minkowski Bisectors, Minkowski Cells, and Lattice Coverings
entry.summary: This article introduces and studies Minkowski Bisectors, Minkowski Cells, and Lattice Coverings.

entry.title: A note on lattice coverings
entry.summary: This note presents an interesting counterexample to a basic covering problem.

entry.title: On Routh-Steiner Theorem and Generalizations
entry.summary: Following Coxeter we use barycentric coordinates in affine geometry to prove theorems on ratios of areas. In particular, we prove a version of Routh-Steiner theorem for parallelograms.

entry.title: On Deformed Dodecahedron Tiling
entry.summary: There is only one type of tilings of the sphere by $12$ congruent pentagons. These tilings are isohedral.

entry.title: Isometries of two dimensional Hilbert Geometries
entry.summary: We prove that any isometry between two dimensional Hilbert geometries is a projective transformation unless the domains are interiors of triangles.

entry.title: The cone volume measure of antipodal points
entry.summary: The optimal condition of the cone volume measure of a pair of antopodal points is proved and analyzed.

entry.title: Diffeomorphic moment-angle manifolds with different Betti numbers
entry.summary: We describe here two simple polytopes that have different Betti numbers and whose moment-angle manifolds are diffeomorphic.

entry.title: Taxicab Butterflies
entry.summary: The Butterfly Theorem is explored in Taxicab Geometry.

entry.title: Generalized convex sets and shadows problem
entry.summary: The problem of shadow is solved. It is equivalent to condition for point is in generalized convex hull of a family of compact sets.

entry.title: On Lattice Coverings by Simplices
entry.summary: By studying the volume of a generalized difference body, this paper presents the first nontrivial lower bound for the lattice covering density by $n$-dimensional simplices.

entry.title: Stability inequalities for projections of convex bodies
entry.summary: We prove several stability and volume difference inequalities for projections of convex bodies and apply them to prove a hyperplane inequality for surface area of projection bodies.

entry.title: Isomorphic Busemann-Petty problem for sections of proportional dimensions
entry.summary: We formulate an isomorphic version of the Busemann-Petty problem and solve it in affirmative in the case of sections of proportional dimensions.

entry.title: Expansive maps are isometries
entry.summary: We show that expansive maps from a dense subset of a compact metric space into the metric space itself are isometries

entry.title: Infinite closed monochromatic subsets of a metric space
entry.summary: Given a coloring of the k-element subsets of an uncountable separable metric space, we show that there exists an infinite monochromatic subset which contains its limit point.

entry.title: Trees and ultrametric Möbius structures
entry.summary: We define the concept of an ultrametric M\"obius space and use this to characterize nonelementary geodesically complete trees.

entry.title: Isometric Embeddability of Snowflakes
entry.summary: We show that a snowflake of a metric space with positive Hausdorff dimension does not admit an isometric embedding into euclidean space.

entry.title: A diversity analogue of the Urysohn metric space
entry.summary: We construct a separable complete diversity that is analogous to the Urysohn metric space.

entry.title: Extremal elements in hypercomplex space
entry.summary: Extremal elements and a h-hull of sets in the n-dimensional hypercomplex space are investigated. Introduced a class of H-quasiconvex sets including strongly hypercomplex convex sets and being closed with respect to intersections.

entry.title: Family of closed convex sets covering faces of a simplex
entry.summary: It is considered a special, convex variant of Sperner lemma type .

entry.title: Measures of sections of convex bodies
entry.summary: This article is a survey of recent results on slicing inequalities for convex bodies. The focus is on the setting of arbitrary measures in place of volume.

entry.title: Extreme points in non-positive curvature
entry.summary: A natural analogue of the Krein--Milman theorem is shown to fail for CAT(0) spaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: (updated version to appear in Studia Math.)

entry.title: On Contact Numbers of Finite Lattice Sphere Packings of 20-27 Balls
entry.summary: Empirical constructions having maximal contact numbers of unit balls as putative best ones are presented for 20-27 balls.

entry.title: Ptolemy constant and uniformity
entry.summary: We study Ptolemy constant and uniformity constant in various plane domains including triangles, quadrilaterals and ellipses.

entry.title: Subspace concentration of dual curvature measures
entry.summary: We prove a tight subspace concentration inequality for the dual curvature measures of a symmetric convex body.

entry.title: Projective configuration theorems: old wine into new wineskins
entry.summary: This is a survey of select recent results by a number of authors, inspired by the classical configuration theorems of projective geometry.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1509.05903

entry.title: Isometry Classes of Planes in $(\mathbb{R}^3,d_{\infty})$
entry.summary: We determine geodesics in $\mathbb{R}_{\infty}^n$ (i.e. $(\mathbb{R}^n, d_{\infty})$) and by using this, classify planes up to isometry in $\mathbb{R}_{\infty}^3$.

entry.title: Barycenters in uniformly convex geodesic spaces
entry.summary: This note proves a result on the existence of barycenters in a class of uniformly convex geodesic spaces.

entry.title: Trimming of finite metric spaces
entry.summary: We define a class of trim metric spaces and show that every finite metric space is the leaf space of a metric forest with trim base.

entry.title: A short note on Godbersen's Conjecture
entry.summary: In this short note we improve the best to date bound in Godbersen's conjecture, and show some implications for unbalanced difference bodies.

entry.title: Asymptotic behavior of metric spaces at infinity
entry.summary: A new sequential approach to investigations of structure of metric spaces at infinity is proposed. Criteria for finiteness and boundedness of metric spaces at infinity are found.

entry.title: Polyhedra with simple dense geodesics
entry.summary: We determine (non-necessarily convex) polyhedra having simple dense geodesics.

entry.title: A survey on Morse boundaries & stability
entry.summary: In this paper we survey many of the known results about Morse boundaries and stability.

entry.title: Almost sure dimension of projections along chains
entry.summary: We prove a version of Marstrand's projection Theorem with respect to the foliation of the three-dimensional sphere $S^3$ by chains.

entry.title: Acute sets
entry.summary: A set of points in $\mathbb{R}^d$ is acute, if any three points from this set form an acute angle. In this note we construct an acute set in $\mathbb{R}^d$ of size at least $2^{d/2}$.

entry.title: An Extension of Heron's Formula
entry.summary: This paper introduces an extension of Heron's formula to approximate area of cyclic n-gons where the error never exceeds $\frac{\pi}{e}-1$

entry.title: The volume of an infinitesimally flexible polyhedron is a multiple root of its volume polynomial
entry.summary: It is proven that the volume of an infinitesimally flexible polyhedron in $R^3$ is a multiple root of its volume polynomial.

entry.title: A Newman property for BLD-mappings
entry.summary: We define a Newman property for BLD-mappings and study its connections to the porosity of the branch set in the setting of generalized manifolds equipped with complete path metrics.

entry.title: Theory of valuations on manifolds, III. Multiplicative structure in the general case
entry.summary: This article is the third part of the series of articles where the theory of valuations on manifolds is constructed. In math.MG/0503399 the notion of a smooth valuation on a manifold was introduced. The goal of this article is to put a canonical multiplicative structure on the space of smooth valuations on general manifolds, thus extending some of the affine constructions from math.MG/0301148, math.MG/0503397.
entry.arxiv:comment: 33 pages; in the title the second sentence is added; the introduction is expanded; minor changes in the abstract; references

entry.title: Theory of valuations on manifolds, IV. New properties of the multiplicative structure
entry.summary: This is the fourth part in the series of articles math.MG/0503397, math.MG/0503399, math.MG/0509512 where the theory of valuations on manifolds is developed. In this part it is shown that the filtration on valuations introduced in math.MG/0503399 is compatible with the product. Then it is proved that the Euler-Verdier involution on smooth valuations introduced in math.MG/0503399 is an automorphism of the algebra of valuations. Then an integration functional on valuations with compact support is introduced, and a property of selfduality of valuations is proved. Next a space of generalized valuations is defined, and some basic properties of it are proved. Finally a canonical imbedding of the space of constructible functions on a real analytic manifold into the space of generalized valuations is constructed, and various structures on valuations are compared with known structures on constructible functions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 40 pages; errors corrected in the proof of Theorems 7.4.1 and 8.4.1
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Geometric aspects of functional analysis, 1--44, Lecture Notes in Math., 1910, Springer, Berlin, 2007

entry.title: Products of hyperbolic metric spaces II
entry.summary: In arXiv math.MG/0207296 we introduced a product construction for locally compact, complete, geodesic hyperbolic metric spaces. In the present paper we define the hyperbolic product for general Gromov-hyperbolic spaces. In the case of roughly geodesic spaces we also analyse the boundary at infinity.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, revised version, proofs have been simplyfied

entry.title: Sphere packings III
entry.summary: This is the fifth in a series of papers giving a proof of the Kepler conjecture, which asserts that the density of a packing of congruent spheres in three dimensions is never greater than $\pi/\sqrt{18}\approx 0.74048...$. This is the oldest problem in discrete geometry and is an important part of Hilbert's 18th problem. An example of a packing achieving this density is the face-centered cubic packing. This paper carries out the third step of the program outlined in math.MG/9811073: A proof that if all of the standard regions are triangles or quadrilaterals, then the total score is less than $8 \pt$ (excluding the case of pentagonal prisms).
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages. Fifth in a series beginning with math.MG/9811071

entry.title: Sphere packings IV
entry.summary: This is the sixth in a series of papers giving a proof of the Kepler conjecture, which asserts that the density of a packing of congruent spheres in three dimensions is never greater than $\pi/\sqrt{18}\approx 0.74048...$. This is the oldest problem in discrete geometry and is an important part of Hilbert's 18th problem. An example of a packing achieving this density is the face-centered cubic packing. This paper completes part of the fourth step of the program outlined in math.MG/9811073: A proof that if some standard region has more than four sides, then the star scores less than $8 \pt$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 53 pages. Sixth in a series beginning with math.MG/9811071

entry.title: Sphere packings V
entry.summary: The Hales program to prove the Kepler conjecture on sphere packings consists of five steps, which if completed, will jointly comprise a proof of the conjecture. We carry out step five of the program [outlined in math.MG/9811073], a proof that the local density of a certain combinatorial arrangement, the pentahedral prism, is less than that of the face-centered cubic lattice packing. We prove various relations on the local density using computer-based interval arithmetic methods. Together, these relations imply the local density bound.
entry.arxiv:comment: 54 pages. Seventh in a series beginning with math.MG/9811071. The author's home page is http://www.math.lsa.umich.edu/~samf/

entry.title: Non Standard Metric Products
entry.summary: We consider a fairly general class of natural non standard metric products and classify those amongst them, which yield a product of certain type (for instance an inner metric space) for all possible choices of factors of this type (inner metric spaces). We further prove the additivity of the Minkowski rank for a large class of metric products.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, This paper extends the results of the second part of arXiv math.MG/0102107. Note that the first part of arXiv math.MG/0102107 has been published in Adv. Geom. 2 (2002), 123-131

entry.title: Ellipsoids of maximal volume in convex bodies
entry.summary: The largest discs contained in a regular tetrahedron lie in its faces. The proof is closely related to the theorem of Fritz John characterising ellipsoids of maximal volume contained in convex bodies.

entry.title: A quasi-polynomial bound for the diameter of graphs of polyhedra
entry.summary: The diameter of the graph of a $d$-dimensional polyhedron with $n$ facets is at most $n^{\log d+2}$

entry.title: On zonoids whose polars are zonoids
entry.summary: Zonoids whose polars are zonoids cannot have proper faces of dimension other than $n-1$ or zero ($n\geq 3$). However, there exist non smooth zonoids whose polars are zonoids. Examples in $R^3$ and $R^4$ are given.

entry.title: On the p-affine surface area
entry.summary: We give geometric interpretations of certain affine invariants of convex bodies. The affine invariants are the p-affine surface areas introduced by Lutwak. The geometric interpretations involve generalizations of the Santal\'o-bodies introduced by the authors in a previous paper.

entry.title: Möbius invariants for pairs of spheres
entry.summary: In this article we construct a complete system of M\"obius-geometric invariants for pairs $(S^m, S^l), l \leq m$, of spheres contained in the M\"obius space $S^n$. It consists of n-m generalised stationary angles. We interpret these invariants geometrically.

entry.title: Tangent Spheres and Triangle Centers
entry.summary: Any four mutually tangent spheres in R^3 determine three coincident lines through opposite pairs of tangencies. As a consequence, we define two new triangle centers.

entry.title: Model sets: a survey
entry.summary: This article surveys the mathematics of the cut and project method as applied to point sets, called here {\em model sets}. It covers the geometric, arithmetic, and analytical sides of this theory as well as diffraction and the connection with dynamical systems.

entry.title: Helly-type Theorems for Plane Convex Curves
entry.summary: Families of translates and homothets of strictly convex curves are proven to possess Helly-type properties generalizing those of a circle. Weaker results are shown for arbitrary convex curves.

entry.title: Trilinear relations between the tetrahedron volumes in a cluster
entry.summary: We prove elegant trilinear formulas connecting products of volumes of Euclidean tetrahedra with vertices taken from a given set of 6 points. We propose a way for generalizing those formulas.

entry.title: Problems on polygons and Bonnesen-type inequalities
entry.summary: In this paper we are interested in some Bonnesen-type isoperimetric inequalities for plane n-gons in relation with the two conjectures proposed by P. Levy and X.M. Zhang.

entry.title: Spacefilling knots
entry.summary: This note describes how to construct toroidal polyhedra which are homotopic to a given type of knot and which admit an isohedral tiling of 3-space.

entry.title: Inequalities of relative weighted metrics
entry.summary: In this paper we present inequalities between two generalizations of the hyperbolic metric and the j_G metric. We also prove inequalities between generalized versions of the j_G metric and Seittenranta's metric.

entry.title: Products of hyperbolic metric spaces
entry.summary: Let (X_i,d_i), i=1,2, be proper geodesic hyperbolic metric spaces. We give a general construction for a ``hyperbolic product'' X_1{times}_h X_2 which is itself a proper geodesic hyperbolic metric space and examine its boundary at infinity.

entry.title: The Honeycomb Problem on the Sphere
entry.summary: The honeycomb problem on the sphere asks for the perimeter-minimizing partition of the sphere into N equal areas. This article solves the problem when N=12. The unique minimizer is a tiling of 12 regular pentagons in the dodecahedral arrangement.

entry.title: Algebraic structures on valuations, their properties and applications
entry.summary: We describe various structures of algebraic nature on the space of continuous valuations on convex sets, their properties (like versions of Poincar\'e duality and hard Lefschetz theorem), and their relations and applications to integral geometry.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 2, 757--764

entry.title: Reflection subgroups of Euclidean reflection groups
entry.summary: In this paper we classify reflection subgroups of Euclidean Coxeter groups.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages; v.2: updated according to referee's comments. Section about finite reflection subgroups added. To appear in Sb. Math

entry.title: On fractal Peano curves
entry.summary: It is proved that for every fractal continuous mapping F: I\to I^2 of the unit interval onto the unit square there is a pair of points x,y\in I, such that |F(x)-F(y)|^2\ge 5|x-y|.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, in Russian, to appear in Proc. Steklov Math. Inst

entry.title: Planar Clusters
entry.summary: We provide upper and lower bounds on the least-perimeter way to enclose and separate n regions of equal area in the plane. Along the way, inside the hexagonal honeycomb, we provide minimizers for each n .

entry.title: Additive Reverses of the Generalised Triangle Inequality in Normed Spaces
entry.summary: Some additive reverses of the generalised triangle inequality in normed linear spaces are given. Applications for complex numbers are provided as well.

entry.title: Area of Polygons in Hyperbolic Geometry
entry.summary: Consider the Poincare disc model for hyperbolic geometry. In this paper, a convenient computational formula is developed along with an aesthetic geometric interpretation. Two proofs, one geometric and one analytical, of each result are given.

entry.title: On coarse embeddability into $\ell_p$-spaces and a conjecture of Dranishnikov
entry.summary: We show that the Hilbert space is coarsely embeddable into any $\ell_p$ for $1\le p<\infty$. In particular, this yields new characterizations of embeddability of separable metric spaces into the Hilbert space.

entry.title: A Potpourri of Schwarz Related Inequalities in Inner Product Spaces
entry.summary: In this paper we obtain some new Schwarz related inequalities in inner product spaces over the real or complex number field. Applications for the generalized triangle inequality are also given.

entry.title: On S.L. Tabachnikov's conjecture
entry.summary: S. L. Tabachnikov's conjecture is proved: for any closed curve $\Gamma$ lying inside convex closed curve $\Gamma_1$ the mean absolute curvature $T(\Gamma)$ exceeds $T(\Gamma_1)$ if $\Gamma\ne k\Gamma_1$. An inequality $T(\Gamma)\ge T(\Gamma_1)$ is proved for curves in a hemisphere.

entry.title: Polyhedra of genus 2 with 10 vertices and minimal coordinates
entry.summary: We give coordinate-minimal geometric realizations in general position of all 865 vertex-minimal triangulations of the orientable surface of genus 2 in the 4x4x4-cube.

entry.title: Coarse geometry and asymptotic dimension
entry.summary: We consider asymptotic dimension of coarse spaces. We analyse coarse structures induced by metrisable compactifications. We calculate asymptotic dimension of coarse cell complexes. We calculate the asymptotic dimension of certain negatively curved spaces, e.g. for complete, simply connected manifolds with bounded, strictly negative sectional curvature.

entry.title: A short proof of rigidity of convex polytopes
entry.summary: We present a much simplified proof of Dehn's theorem on the infinitesimal rigidity of convex polytopes. Our approach is based on the ideas of Trushkina and Schramm.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Siberian Journal of Mathematics; 5 pages 2 figures

entry.title: On $\pmb{p}$-quermassintegral differences function
entry.summary: In this paper we establish Minkowski inequality and Brunn--Minkowski inequality for $p$-quermassintegral differences of convex bodies. Further, we give Minkowski inequality and Brunn--Minkowski inequality for quermassintegral differences of mixed projection bodies.

entry.title: Inflating the cube without stretching
entry.summary: We give a simple proof of the following result: There exists a non-convex polyhedron whose surface is isometric to the surface of a cube of smaller volume.

entry.title: Steiner's Invariants and Minimal Connections
entry.summary: The aim of this note is to prove that any compact metric space can be made connected at a minimal cost, where the cost is taken to be the one-dimensional Hausdorff measure.

entry.title: A Very Intuitive Geometric Picture of the 24-cell, $E_8$ and $Λ_{16}$ Lattices Given by Using the Hopf Maps
entry.summary: We use the Hopf fibrillation to give simple and intuitive geometric constructions of the 24-cell, $E_8$ and $\Lambda_{16}$ lattices.

entry.title: In orbifolds, small isoperimetric regions are small balls
entry.summary: In a compact orbifold, for small prescribed volume, an isoperimetric region is close to a small metric ball; in a Euclidean orbifold, it is a small metric ball.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, final version to appear in Proc. Amer. Math. Soc

entry.title: On some points-and-lines problems and configurations
entry.summary: We apply an old method for constructing points-and-lines configurations in the plane to study some recent questions in incidence geometry.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, numerous figures of point-and-line configurations; to appear in the Bezdek-50 special issue of Periodica Mathematica Hungarica

entry.title: A sharp Rogers-Shephard type inequality for the p-difference body of a planar convex body
entry.summary: We prove a sharp Rogers-Shephard type inequality for the p-difference body of a convex body in the two-dimensional case, for every p greater than or equal to one.

entry.title: A characterization of hyperbolic geometry among Hilbert geometry
entry.summary: In this paper we characterize hyperbolic geometry among Hilbert geometry by the property that three medians of any hyperbolic triangle all pass through one point.

entry.title: Proof of the Double Bubble Conjecture in R^n
entry.summary: The least-area hypersurface enclosing and separating two given volumes in R^n is the standard double bubble.

entry.title: A Small Polyhedral Z-Acyclic 2-Complex in R4
entry.summary: We present a small 4-dimensional polyhedral realization of a 2-dimensional Z-acyclic but non-contractible simplicial complex.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 3 figures, submitted to Electronic Geometry Models

entry.title: Simultaneous packing and covering in the two-dimensional Euclidean plane II
entry.summary: This paper determines the optimal upper bound for the simultaneous packing and covering constants of the two-dimensional centrally symmetric convex domains. It solved a problem opening for more than thirty years.

entry.title: A note for Gromov's distance functions on the space of mm-spaces
entry.summary: This is just a note for \cite[Chapter$3{1/2}_+$]{gromov}. Maybe this note is obvious for a reader who knows metric geometry. I wish that someone study further in this direction.

entry.title: Knotted Polyhedral Tori
entry.summary: For every knot K with stick number k there is a knotted polyhedral torus of knot type K with 3k vertices. We prove that at least 3k-2 vertices are necessary.

entry.title: Modified Shephard's problem on projections of convex bodies
entry.summary: We disprove a conjecture of A. Koldobsky asking whether it is enough to compare $(n-2)$-derivatives of the projection functions of two symmetric convex bodies in the Shephard problem in order to get a positive answer in all dimensions.

entry.title: Convergence of weighted averages of relaxed projections
entry.summary: The convergence of the algorithm for solving convex feasibility problem is studied by the method of sequential averaged and relaxed projections. Some results of H. H. Bauschke and J. M. Borwein are generalized by introducing new methods. Examples illustrating these generalizations are given.

entry.title: Local Convexity Properties of j-metric Balls
entry.summary: This paper deals with local convexity properties of the j-metric. We consider convexity and starlikeness of the j-metric balls in convex, starlike and general subdomains of R^n.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Annales Academiae Scientiarum Fennicae Mathematica

entry.title: Local Convexity Properties of Quasihyperbolic Balls in Punctured Space
entry.summary: This paper deals with local convexity properties of the quasihyperbolic metric in the punctured space. We consider convexity and starlikeness of quasihyperbolic balls.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to Journal of Mathematical Analysis and Applications

entry.title: A note on pairs of metrics in a two-dimensional linear vector space
entry.summary: Pairs of metrics in a two-dimensional linear vector space are considered, one of which is a Minkowski type metric. Their simultaneous diagonalizability is studied and canonical presentations for them are suggested.

entry.title: The Lonely Vertex Problem
entry.summary: In a locally finite tiling of n-dim Euclidean space by convex polytopes, each point of the space is either a vertex of at least two tiles, or no vertex at all.

entry.title: A note on pairs of metrics in a three-dimensional linear vector space
entry.summary: Pairs of metrics in a three-dimensional linear vector space are considered, one of which is a Minkowski type metric with the signature (+,-,-). Such metric pairs are classified and canonical presentations for them in each class are suggested.

entry.title: Existence of Least-perimeter Partitions
entry.summary: We prove the existence of a perimeter-minimizing partition of R^n into regions of unit volume. We conclude with a short tribute to the late Manuel A. Fortes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages; for submission to Fortes memorial isue of Philosphical Magazine Letters

entry.title: Macroscopic dimension of the $\ell^p$-ball with respect to the $\ell^q$-norm
entry.summary: We show estimates of the "macroscopic dimension" of the $\ell^p$-ball with respect to the $\ell^q$-norm.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Mathematics of Kyoto University, 48-2 (2008), 445-454

entry.title: Simplices and spectra of graphs
entry.summary: In this note we show the n-2-dimensional volumes of codimension 2 faces of an n-dimensional simplex are algebraically independent functions of the lengths of edges. In order to prove this we compute the complete spectrum of a combinatorially interesting graph.

entry.title: The discrete square peg problem
entry.summary: The square peg problem asks whether every Jordan curve in the plane has four points which form a square. The problem has been resolved (positively) for various classes of curves, but remains open in full generality. We present two new direct proofs for the case of piecewise linear curves.

entry.title: Hilbert domains quasi-isometric to normed vector spaces
entry.summary: We prove that a Hilbert domain which is quasi-isometric to a normed vector space is actually a convex polytope.

entry.title: Hilbert geometry for convex polygonal domains
entry.summary: We prove in this paper that the Hilbert geometry associated with an open convex polygonal set is Lipschitz equivalent to Euclidean plane.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Geometry, Volume 100, Numbers 1-2, pages 37-64, 2011

entry.title: Concentration of maps and group action
entry.summary: In this paper, from the viewpoint of the concentration theory of maps, we study a compact group and a L\'{e}vy group action to a large class of metric spaces, such as R-trees, doubling spaces, metric graphs, and Hadamard manifolds.

entry.title: Les groupes de triangles $(2,p,q)$ sont détermineés par leur spectre des longueurs
entry.summary: We describe the length spectra of triangle groups $(2,p,q)$ before showing that the length spectra characterizes the isometry class of such a group.
entry.arxiv:comment: 29 pages, in french, to appear in Annales Institut Fourier

entry.title: Concrete Constructions of Real Equiangular Line Sets
entry.summary: We give some concrete constructions of real equiangular line sets. The emphasis here is on {\em building blocks} for certain angles which are then used to build up larger equiangular line sets. We concentrate on angles greater than or equal to 1/7.

entry.title: Two Strange Constructions in the Euclidean Plane
entry.summary: We present two new constructions in the usual euclidean plane. We only deal with 'Grecian Geometry', with this phrase we mean elementary geometry in the two-dimensional space R 2 . We describe and prove two propositions about 'projections'. The proofs need only elementary analytical knowledge.

entry.title: Group actions on geodesic Ptolemy spaces
entry.summary: In this paper we study geodesic Ptolemy metric spaces $X$ which allow proper and cocompact isometric actions of crystallographic or, more generally, virtual polycyclic groups. We show that $X$ is equivariantly rough isometric to a Euclidean space.

entry.title: The Dehn invariants of the Bricard octahedra
entry.summary: We prove that the Dehn invariants of any Bricard octahedron remain constant during the flex and that the Strong Bellows Conjecture holds true for the Steffen flexible polyhedron.

entry.title: Products of metric spaces, covering numbers, packing numbers and characterizations of ultrametric spaces
entry.summary: We describe some Cartesian products of metric spaces and find conditions under which products of ultrametric spaces are ultrametric.

entry.title: A dual characterization of length spaces with application to Dirichlet metric spaces
entry.summary: We show that under minimal assumptions, the intrinsic metric induced by a strongly local Dirichlet form induces a length space. A main input is a dual characterization of length spaces in terms of the property that the 1-Lipschitz functions form a sheaf.

entry.title: On a generalization of the Blaschke-Lebesgue theorem for disk-polygons
entry.summary: In this paper we prove an extension of the Blaschke-Lebesgue theorem for a family of convex domains called disk-polygons. Also, this provides yet another new proof of the Blaschke-Lebesgue theorem.

entry.title: Tangent spaces to metric spaces and to their subspaces
entry.summary: We investigate a tangent space at a point of a general metric space and metric space valued derivatives. The conditions under which two different subspace of a metric space have isometric tangent spaces in a common point of these subspaces are completely determinated.

entry.title: Ultrametricity and metric betweenness in tangent spaces to metric spaces
entry.summary: The paper deals with pretangent spaces to general metric spaces. An ltrametricity criterion for pretangent spaces is found and it is closely related to the metric betweenness in the pretangent spaces.

entry.title: Exponential and Gaussian concentration of 1-Lipschitz maps
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove an exponential and Ganssian concentration inequality for 1-Lipschitz maps from mm-spaces to Hadamard manifolds. In particular, we give a complete answer to a question by M. Gromov.

entry.title: A Dense Packing of Regular Tetrahedra
entry.summary: We construct a dense packing of regular tetrahedra, with packing density $D > >.7786157$.

entry.title: Lipschitz equivalence of subsets of self-conformal sets
entry.summary: We give sufficient conditions to guarantee that if two self-conformal sets E and F have Lipschitz equivalent subsets of positive measure, then there is a bilipschitz map of E into, or onto, F.

entry.title: Packing points into a unit cube in higher space
entry.summary: In this paper using the concept of the extended Hamming code we give a construction for dense packing of points at distance at least one in such unit cubes which dimension are a power of two.

entry.title: The visual boundary of Z^2
entry.summary: We introduce ideas from geometric group theory related to boundaries of groups. This is a mostly expository paper. We consider the visual boundary of a free abelian group, and show that it is an uncountable set with the trivial topology.

entry.title: Jarnik's convex lattice $n$-gon for non-symmetric norms
entry.summary: What is the minimum perimeter of a convex lattice $n$-gon? This question was answered by Jarnik in 1926. We solve the same question in the case when perimeter is measured by a (not necessarily symmetric) norm.

entry.title: Tube Formula for Self-Similar Fractals with non-Steiner-like Generators
entry.summary: We give a direct, pointwise proof for the tube formula of Lapidus-Pearse for self-similar fractals, where we allow non-convex, non-Steiner-like generators.

entry.title: Hyperbolic triangles of the maximum area with two fixed sides
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to consider the Lobachevskii geometry analog of a well-known Euclidian problem; namely: to find a triangle with two fixed sides and the maximum area
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 4 figures, to appear in Mat. Prosvetshenie

entry.title: Alexandrov curvature of convex hypersurfaces in Hilbert space
entry.summary: It is shown that convex hypersurfaces in Hilbert spaces have nonnegative Alexandrov curvature. This extends an earlier result of Buyalo for convex hypersurfaces in Riemannian manifolds of finite dimension.

entry.title: Removing chambers in Bruhat-Tits buildings
entry.summary: We introduce and study a family of countable groups constructed from Euclidean buildings by "removing" suitably chosen subsets of chambers.

entry.title: Generic Properties of Compact Metric Spaces
entry.summary: We prove that there is a residual subset of the Gromov-Hausdorff space (i.e. the space of all compact metric spaces up to isometry endowed with the Gromov-Hausdorff distance) whose points enjoy several unexpected properties. In particular, they have zero lower box dimension and infinite upper box dimension.

entry.title: Fixed points and lines in 2-metric spaces
entry.summary: We consider bounded 2-metric spaces satisfying an additional axiom, and show that a contractive mapping has either a fixed point or a fixed line.

entry.title: Functions of Substitution Tilings as a Jacobian
entry.summary: In this paper we show that the function defined by a primitive, star shaped substitu- tion tiling of the plane, can be realized as a Jacobian of a biLipschitz homeomorphism of R^2. In particular it holds for any Penrose tiling.

entry.title: On Some Results Related to Napoleon's Configurations
entry.summary: The goal of this paper is to give a purely geometric proof of a theorem by Branko Gr\"unbaum concerning configuration of triangles coming from the classical Napoleon's theorem in planar Euclidean geometry.

entry.title: Convex Bodies With Minimal Volume Product in R^2 --- A New Proof
entry.summary: In this paper, a new proof of the following result is given: The product of the volumes of an origin symmetric convex bodies $K$ in R^2 and of its polar body is minimal if and only if $K$ is a parallelogram.

entry.title: Irreducible Elements in Metric Lattices
entry.summary: We describe a natural generalization of irreducibility in order lattices with arbitrary metrics. We analyse the special cases of valuation metrics and more general metrics for lattices. This article is mainly based on a part of the author's doctoral thesis, but answers some additional questions.

entry.title: On cyclic CAT(0) domains of discontinuity
entry.summary: Let $X$ be a CAT(0) space, and $G$ a discrete cyclic group of isometries of $X$. We investigate the domain of discontinuity for the action of $G$ on the boundary $\partial X$.

entry.title: Calculus of generalized hyperbolic tetrahedron
entry.summary: We calculate the Jacobian matrix of the dihedral angles of a generalized hyperbolic tetrahedron as functions of edge lengths and find the complete set of symmetries of this matrix.

entry.title: On Edwards-Child's inequality
entry.summary: In this paper, by making use of one of Chen's theorems and the method of mathematical analysis, we refine Edwards-Child's inequality and solve a conjecture posed by Liu.

entry.title: The Four Hagge Circles
entry.summary: The four Hagge circles of the triangles BCD, ACD, ABD, ABC of a cyclic quadrilateral ABCD with respect to an appropriate common axis of inverse similarity share many features which are analysed.

entry.title: Curvature bounded below: a definition a la Berg--Nikolaev
entry.summary: We give a new characterization of spaces with nonnegative curvature in the sense of Alexandrov.

entry.title: Cyclic polygons in classical geometry
entry.summary: Formulas about the side lengths, diagonal lengths or radius of the circumcircle of a cyclic polygon in Euclidean geometry, hyperbolic geometry or spherical geometry can be unified.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Comptes rendus de l' Academie bulgare des Sciences, Vol. 64 (2011), no. 2, 185--194

entry.title: Tilings by translation
entry.summary: This is a survey about tiling by translation only and related questions and methods, especially those that have to do with Fourier Analysis.

entry.title: Notes on completely reducible subcomplexes of spherical buildings
entry.summary: A completely reducible subcomplex of a spherical building is a spherical building.
entry.arxiv:comment: These are notes from April 2008. They were presented at an Oberwolfach Conference in November 2008

entry.title: Triangle in a brick
entry.summary: In this paper we shall investigate the following problem: Which is the largest regular triangle in a brick with volume 1 and having edge lengthes greater than $\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}$? We prove that there are three optimal cases in all which the edge lengthes of the triangles are $\sqrt{2}$, respectively.

entry.title: Slow ultrafilters and asymptotic cones of proper metric spaces
entry.summary: In this paper I present an elementary construction to prove that any proper metric space can arise as the asymptotic cone of another proper metric space. Furthermore I answer a question of Drutu and Sapir concerning slow ultrafilters.

entry.title: Nonamenable Liouville Graphs
entry.summary: Add to each level of binary tree edges to make the induced graph on the level a uniform expander. It is shown that such a graph admits no non-constant bounded harmonic functions.

entry.title: An area formula in metric spaces
entry.summary: We present an area formula for continuous mappings between metric spaces, under minimal regularity assumptions. In particular, we do not require any notion of differentiability. This is a consequence of a measure theoretic notion of Jacobian, defined as the density of a suitable "pull-back measure".

entry.title: Convex Multivariate Approximation by Algebras of Continuous Functions
entry.summary: We obtain an analog of Shvedov theorem for convex multivariate approximation by algebras of continuous functions.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Advances in constructive approximation: Vanderbilt 2003, 123-131, Mod. Methods Math., Nashboro Press, Brentwood, TN, 2004

entry.title: Metric spaces: The definition, and some examples
entry.summary: These informal notes were prepared in connection with a lecture at a high school mathematics tournament, and provide an overview of some examples of metric spaces and a few of their basic properties.

entry.title: Random groups have fixed points on CAT(0) cube complexes
entry.summary: We prove that a random group has fixed points when it isometrically acts on a CAT(0) cube complex. We do not assume that the action is simplicial.

entry.title: Taxicab Triangle Incircles and Circumcircles
entry.summary: Inscribed angles are investigated in taxicab geometry with application to the existence and uniqueness of inscribed and circumscribed taxicab circles of triangles.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: The Pi Mu Epsilon Journal, Worcester, MA. Vol. 13, No. 5 (Fall 2011)

entry.title: Waist of the sphere for maps to manifolds
entry.summary: We generalize the sphere waist theorem of Gromov and the Borsuk--Ulam type measure partition lemma of Gromov--Memarian for maps to manifolds.

entry.title: The equal tangents problem
entry.summary: Given a plane oval, is it possible to go around it so that, at all times, the two tangent segments to the oval from the moving point have unequal lengths? In this note we construct an example of such an oval.

entry.title: Classification of Convex lattice polytopes
entry.summary: In this paper we study the classification problem of convex lattice ploytopes with respect to given volume or given cardinality.

entry.title: Rotations in three, four, and five dimensions
entry.summary: The geometry of rotations in dimensions 3, 4, and 5 is discussed using the matrix exponential map. Explicit closed formulas for the exponential of an antisymmetric matrix, as well as the logarithm of a rotation, are given for these dimensions.

entry.title: A countable set of directions is sufficient for Steiner symmetrization
entry.summary: A countable dense set of directions is sufficient for Steiner symmetrization, but the order of directions matters.

entry.title: Local dimensions of measures on self-affine sets
entry.summary: We show that, in a generic setting, self-affine and almost self-affine measures are exact dimensional, with local dimension equal almost everywhere to the information dimension and given by the zero of a superadditive pressure functional.

entry.title: Stronger versions of the Orlicz-Petty projection inequality
entry.summary: We verify a conjecture of Lutwak, Yang, Zhang about the equality case in the Orlicz-Petty projection inequality, and provide an essentially optimal stability version.

entry.title: An algorithm for computing the centered Hausdorff measure of self-similar sets
entry.summary: We provide an algorithm for computing the centered Hausdorff measure of self-similar sets satisfying the strong separation condition. We prove the convergence of the algorithm and test its utility on some examples.

entry.title: Isometric embeddings of pretangent spaces in E^n
entry.summary: We prove some infinitesimal analogs of classical results of Menger, Schoenberg and Blumenthal giving the existence conditions for isometric embeddings of metric spaces in the finite-dimensional Euclidean spaces.

entry.title: Stability of Heisenberg Isoperimetric Profiles
entry.summary: In the context of sub-Riemannian Heisenberg groups Hn, n \geq 1, we shall study Isoperimetric Profiles, which are closed compact hypersurfaces having constant horizontal mean curvature, very similar to ellipsoids. Our main goal is to study the stability of Isoperimetric Profiles.

entry.title: Dimension Reduction in $L_p$, $0<p<2$
entry.summary: Complementing a recent observation of Newman and Rabinovich for $p=1$ we observe here that for all $0<p<2$ any $k$ points in $L_p$ embeds with distortion $(1+\e)$ into $\ell_p^n$ where $n$ is linear in $k$ (and polynomial in $\e^{-1}$).

entry.title: Deformations of crystal frameworks
entry.summary: We apply our deformation theory of periodic bar-and-joint frameworks to tetrahedral crystal structures. The deformation space is investigated in detail for frameworks modelled on quartz, cristobalite and tridymite.

entry.title: A strong form of the Quantitative Isoperimetric inequality
entry.summary: We give a refinement of the quantitative isoperimetric inequality. We prove that the isoperimetric gap controls not only the Fraenkel asymmetry but also the oscillation of the boundary.

entry.title: Inscribable stacked polytopes
entry.summary: We characterize the combinatorial types of stacked d-polytopes that are inscribable. Equivalently, we identify the triangulations of a simplex by stellar subdivisions that can be realized as Delaunay triangulations.

entry.title: The isotropic position and the reverse Santaló inequality
entry.summary: We present proofs of the reverse Santal\'{o} inequality, the existence of M-ellipsoids and the reverse Brunn-Minkowski inequality, using purely convex geometric tools. Our approach is based on properties of the isotropic position.

entry.title: A generalization of Routh's triangle theorem
entry.summary: We prove a generalization of the well known Routh's triangle theorem. As a consequence, we get a unification of the theorems of Ceva and Menelaus. A connection to Feynman's triangle is also given.

entry.title: Bodies invisible from one point
entry.summary: We show that there exist bodies with mirror surface invisible from a point in the framework of geometrical optics. In particular, we provide an example of a connected three-dimensional body invisible from one point.

entry.title: The filling problem in the cube
entry.summary: We prove an isoperimetric inequality for filling cellular cycles in a high dimensional cube with cellular chains. In addition, we provide a family of cubical cellular cycles for which the exponent in the inequality is optimal.

entry.title: Embedding proper ultrametric spaces into $\ell_p$ and its application to nonlinear Dvoretzky's theorem
entry.summary: We prove that every proper ultrametric space isometrically embeds into $\ell_p$ for any $p\geq 1$. As an application we discuss an $\ell_p$-version of nonlinear Dvoretzky's theorem.

entry.title: A note on orthogonality of subspaces in Euclidean geometry
entry.summary: We show that Euclidean geometry in suitably high dimension can be expressed as a theory of orthogonality of subspaces with fixed dimensions and fixed dimension of their meet.

entry.title: The rigidity of periodic body-bar frameworks on the three-dimensional fixed torus
entry.summary: We present necessary and sufficient conditions for the generic rigidity of body-bar frameworks on the three-dimensional fixed torus. These frameworks correspond to infinite periodic body-bar frameworks in $\mathbb{R}^3$ with a fixed periodic lattice.

entry.title: Majorization in spaces with a curved geometry
entry.summary: The Hardy-Littlewood-P?olya majorization theorem is extended to the framework of some spaces with a curved geometry (such as the global NPC spaces and the Wasserstein spaces). We also discuss the connection between our concept of majorization and the subject of Schur convexity.

entry.title: Remarks on the equality case of the Bonnesen inequality
entry.summary: An argument is provided for the equality case of the high dimensional Bonnesen inequality for sections. The known equality case of the Bonnesen inequality for projections is presented as a consequence.

entry.title: Stability of the functional forms of the Blaschke-Santalo inequality
entry.summary: Stability versions of the functional forms of the Blaschke-Santalo inequality due to Ball, Artstein-Klartag-Milman, Fradelizi-Meyer and Lehec are proved.

entry.title: Sets of tetrahedra, defined by maxima of distance functions
entry.summary: We study tetrahedra and the space of tetrahedra from the viewpoint of local and global maxima for intrinsic distance functions.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: An. St. Univ. Ovidius Constanta, Vol. 20(2), 2012, 197-212

entry.title: Viscosity iteration in CAT(k) spaces
entry.summary: We study the approximation of fixed points of nonexpansive mappings in CAT(k) spaces. We show that the iterative sequence generated by the Moudafi's viscosity type algorithm converges to one of the fixed points of the nonexpansive mapping depending on the contraction applied in the algorithm.

entry.title: Stability and separation in volume comparison problems
entry.summary: We review recent stability and separation results in volume comparison problems and use them to prove several hyper- plane inequalities for intersection and projection bodies.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1101.3600, arXiv:1204.2530

entry.title: Crofton measures and Minkowski valuations
entry.summary: A description of continuous rigid motion compatible Minkowski valuations is established. As an application, we present a Brunn-Minkowski type inequality for intrinsic volumes of these valuations.

entry.title: On the translative packing densities of tetrahedra and cubooctahedra
entry.summary: In this paper, upper bounds for the densities of the densest translative tetrahedron packings and the densest translative cubooctahedron packings are obtained.

entry.title: A necessary flexibility condition of a nondegenerate suspension in Lobachevsky 3-space
entry.summary: We show that some combination of the lengths of all edges of the equator of a flexible suspension in Lobachevsky 3-space is equal to zero (each length is taken either positive or negative in this combination).

entry.title: Alexandrov's Approach to the Minkowski Problem
entry.summary: This article is dedicated to the centenary of the birth of Aleksandr D. Alexandrov (1912-1999). His functional-analytical approach to the solving of the Minkowski problem is examined and applied to the extremal problems of isoperimetric type with conflicting goals.

entry.title: The Abresch-Gromoll inequality in a non-smooth setting
entry.summary: We prove that the Abresch-Gromoll inequality holds on infinitesimally Hilbertian CD(K,N) spaces in the same form as the one available on smooth Riemannian manifolds.

entry.title: Perimeter under multiple Steiner symmetrizations
entry.summary: Steiner symmetrization along n linearly independent directions transforms every compact subset of R^n into a set of finite perimeter.

entry.title: A Proof of Fejes Toth's Conjecture on Sphere Packings with Kissing Number Twelve
entry.summary: In 1969, Fejes Toth conjectured that in Euclidean 3-space any packing of equal balls such that each ball is touched by twelve others consists of hexagonal layers. This article verifies this conjecture.

entry.title: Fixed-point property of random quotients by plain words
entry.summary: We show a fixed-point property of random quotients by plain words for a wide class of CAT(0) spaces.

entry.title: The Sum of Squares Law
entry.summary: We show that when projecting an edge-transitive N-dimensional polytope onto anM-dimensional subspace of R^N, the sums of the squares of the original and projected edges are in the ratio N=M.

entry.title: On tensor products of semistable lattices
entry.summary: We give an elementary proof of low rank cases of the conjecture that the tensor product of two semistable Euclidean lattices is again semistable.

entry.title: A definitional view of Vogt's variant of the Mazur-Ulam theorem
entry.summary: A rephrasing of Vogt's and Skof's version of the Ula,m-Mazur theorem as a definiability statement.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Victor Pambuccian, A definitional view of Vogt's variant of the Mazur-Ulam theorem Algebra, Geometry \& Their Applications. Seminar Proceedings} \bf{1} (2001), 5--10

entry.title: Ptolemy spaces with strong inversions
entry.summary: We prove that a compact Ptolemy space with many strong inversions that contains a Ptolemy circle is Moebius equivalent to an extended Euclidean space.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages. arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1012.1699, arXiv:1211.3237 by other authors

entry.title: The isometry group of the bounded Urysohn space is simple
entry.summary: We show that the isometry group of the bounded Urysohn space is simple. This extends previous work by the authors.

entry.title: Discrete Conics
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduce discrete conics, polygonal analogues of conics. We show that discrete conics satisfy a number of nice properties analogous to those of conics, and arise naturally from several constructions, including the discrete negative pedal construction and an action of a group acting on a focus-sharing pencil of conics.

entry.title: Almost all sets of d+2 points on the (d-1)-sphere are not subtransitive
entry.summary: We generalise an argument of Leader, Russell, and Walters to show that almost all sets of d + 2 points on the (d - 1)-sphere S^{d-1} are not contained in a transitive set in some R^n.

entry.title: Collapsing three-dimensional closed Alexandrov spaces with a lower curvature bound
entry.summary: In the present paper, we determine the topologies of three-dimensional closed Alexandrov spaces which converge to lower dimensional spaces in the Gromov-Hausdorff topology.

entry.title: Pretangent spaces with nonpositive and nonnegative Aleksandrov curvature
entry.summary: We find conditions under which the pretangent spaces to general metric spaces have the nonpositive Aleksandrov curvature or nonnegative one. The infinitesimal structure of general metric cpaces with Busemann convex pretangent spaces is also described.

entry.title: Ball-preserving mappings of finite ultrametric spaces
entry.summary: It is shown that the rooted trees $T_X$ and $T_Y$ representing finite ultrametric spaces $X$ and $Y$ are isomorphic if and only if there exists a ball-preserving bijection $F:X\to Y$.

entry.title: Sequential ends of metric spaces
entry.summary: We develop an analog to the ends of a metric space for the category of coarse metric spaces and show that it is equivalent to a previously defined coarse invariant.

entry.title: Well separated spherical designs
entry.summary: For each $N\ge C_dt^d$ we prove the existence of a well separated spherical $t$-design in the sphere $S^d$ consisting of $N$ points, where $C_d$ is a constant depending only on $d$.

entry.title: Ghostbusting and property A
entry.summary: We show that a bounded geometry metric space X has property A if and only if all ghost operators on X are compact.

entry.title: Barrow's Inequality and Signed Angle Bisectors
entry.summary: In this paper we give one extension of Barrow's type inequality in the plane of the triangle ABC introduce signed angle bisectors.

entry.title: Origin of emergent algebras
entry.summary: This is an expository article concerning the last section "Why is the tangent space a group?" (section 8) of the article by A. Bellaiche, The tangent space in sub-riemannian geometry, from the viewpoint of emergent algebras.

entry.title: Circular Surfaces $\mathcal {CS}(α,p)$
entry.summary: In this paper we define and construct a new class of algebraic surfaces in three-dimensional Euclidean space generated by a curve and a congruence of circles. We study their properties and visualize them with the program Mathematica.

entry.title: A metric characterization of Carnot groups
entry.summary: We give a short axiomatic introduction to Carnot groups and their subRiemannian and subFinsler geometry. We explain how such spaces can be metrically described as exactly those proper geodesic spaces that admit dilations and are isometrically homogeneous.

entry.title: Lipschitz conditions and the distance ratio metric
entry.summary: We give study the Lipschitz continuity of M\"obius transformations of a punctured disk onto another punctured disk with respect to the distance ratio metric.

entry.title: Generalized Rose Surfaces and their Visualizations
entry.summary: In this paper we construct a new class of algebraic surfaces in three-dimensional Euclidean space generated by a cyclic-harmonic curve and a congruence of circles. We study their properties and visualize them with the program Mathematica.

entry.title: Aleksandrov-Fenchel inequality for coconvex bodies
entry.summary: We prove a version of the Aleksandrov-Fenchel inequality for mixed volumes of coconvex bodies. This version is motivated by an inequality from commutative algebra relating intersection multiplicities of ideals.

entry.title: Linear programming duality for geometers
entry.summary: We present a geometric proof for the duality theorem of linear programming. Besides being self-contained and simple, the present approach also provides a transparent way for understanding this fundamental result.

entry.title: The approximation to a fixed point
entry.summary: In a spherically complete ultrametric space, a strictly contracting mapping has a fixed point. We indicate in this paper how this fixed point can either be reached or approximated.

entry.title: A doubling subset of $L_p$ for $p>2$ that is inherently infinite dimensional
entry.summary: It is shown that for every $p\in (2,\infty)$ there exists a doubling subset of $L_p$ that does not admit a bi-Lipschitz embedding into $\R^k$ for any $k\in \N$.

entry.title: Geodesic paths in the finite dimensional unit sphere under sup norm
entry.summary: We characterize geodesic paths in the $n$-dimensional unit sphere under sup norm. A geodesic path between two points is a shortest curve joining the two points.

entry.title: Estimates for measures of sections of convex bodies
entry.summary: A $\sqrt{n}$ estimate in the hyperplane problem with arbitrary measures has recently been proved in \cite{K3}. In this note we present analogs of this result for sections of lower dimensions and in the complex case. We deduce these inequalities from stability in comparison problems for different generalizations of intersection bodies.

entry.title: Helly type theorems for the sum of vectors in a normed plane
entry.summary: The main results here are two Helly type theorems for the sum of (at most) unit vectors in a normed plane. Also, we give a new characterization of centrally symmetric convex sets in the plane.

entry.title: Hölder continuity of normal cycles and of support measures of convex bodies
entry.summary: We provide an estimate of the distance (in the dual flat seminorm) of the normal cycles of convex bodies with given Hausdorff distance. We also give an estimate (in the bounded Lipschitz metric) of the support measures of convex bodies.

entry.title: The Mixed Poncelet-Steiner Closure Theorem
entry.summary: We state and prove a new closure theorem closely related to the classical closure theorems of Poncelet and Steiner. Along the way, we establish a number of theorems concerning conic sections.

entry.title: A remark on perimeter-diameter and perimeter-circumradius inequalities under lattice constraints
entry.summary: In this note, we study several inequalities involving geometric functionals for lattice point-free planar convex sets. We focus on the previously not addressed cases perimeter--diameter and perimeter--circumradius.

entry.title: Algebraic characterization of quasi-isometric spaces via the Higson compactification
entry.summary: The purpose of this article is to characterize the quasi-isometry type of a proper metric space via the Banach algebra of Higson functions on it.

entry.title: Closed BLD-elliptic manifolds have virtually Abelian fundamental groups
entry.summary: We show that a closed, connected, oriented, Riemannian $n$-manifold, admitting a branched cover of bounded length distortion from $\mathbb R^n$, has a virtually Abelian fundamental group.

entry.title: Exact Hausdorff Measure of Certain Non-Self-Similar Cantor Sets
entry.summary: We establish a formula yielding the Hausdorff measure for a class of non-self-similar Cantor sets in terms of the canonical covers of the Cantor set.

entry.title: Optimal Pair of Two Linear Varieties
entry.summary: The optimal pair of two linear varieties is considered as a best approximation problem, namely the distance between a point and the difference set of two linear varieties. The Gram determinant allows to get the optimal pair in closed form.

entry.title: Enumeration of irreducible contact graphs on the sphere
entry.summary: In this article, using the computer, are enumerated all locally-rigid packings by $N$ congruent circles (spherical caps) on the unit sphere ${\Bbb S}^2 $ with $N < 12.$ This is equivalent to the enumeration of irreducible spherical contact graphs.

entry.title: Variational properties of the discrete Hilbert-Einstein functional
entry.summary: This is a survey on rigidity and geometrization results obtained with the help of the discrete Hilbert-Einstein functional, written for the proceedings of the "Discrete Curvature" colloquium in Luminy.

entry.title: Tube Volumes via Functional Equations
entry.summary: We give a very simple approach to the computation of tube volumes of self-similar sprays using a functional equation satisfied by them.

entry.title: Du-Hwang Characteristic Area: Catch-22
entry.summary: The paper is devoted to description of two interconnected mistakes generated by the gap in the Du and Hwang approach to Gilbert-Pollack Steiner ratio conjecture.

entry.title: Regular Polygonal Complexes of Higher Ranks in E^3
entry.summary: The paper establishes that the rank of a regular polygonal complex in 3-space E^3 cannot exceed 4, and that the only regular polygonal complexes of rank 4 in 3-space are the eight regular 4-apeirotopes.

entry.title: Poincaré inequalities for mutually singular measures
entry.summary: Using an inverse system of metric graphs as in: J. Cheeger and B. Kleiner, "Inverse limit spaces satisfying a Poincar\'e inequality", we provide a simple example of a metric space $X$ that admits Poincar\'e inequalities for a continuum of mutually singular measures.

entry.title: The adjacent sides of hyperbolic Lambert quadrilaterals
entry.summary: We prove sharp bounds for the product and the sum of a pair of hyperbolic adjacent sides of hyperbolic Lambert quadrilaterals in the unit disk.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 3 figures. arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1203.6494

entry.title: On the Flexibility of Suspensions
entry.summary: We study the flexibility of suspensions (polyhedra having the combinatorial structure of dipyramids) that have an even number of vertexes and provide arguments that there are least five distinct types of flexible suspensions.

entry.title: A complete 3-dimensional Blaschke-Santaló diagram
entry.summary: We present a complete 3-dimensional Blaschke-Santal\'o diagram for planar convex bodies with respect to the four classical magnitudes inner and outer radius, diameter and (minimal) width in euclidean spaces.

entry.title: On the displacement function of isometries of Euclidean buildings
entry.summary: In this note we study the displacement function $d_g(x):=d(gx,x)$ of an isometry $g$ of a Euclidean building. We give a lower bound for $d_g(x)$ depending on the distance from $x$ to the minimal set of $g$.

entry.title: Hyperbolic plane geometry revisited
